title: Who makes a lightweight accordion? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most makers. Hohner. They are actually cheaper than big heavy ones. But usually the tradeoff is that they have fewer keys, or reeds per note, and tone switches. They are less expensive though, and may be designated beginner, student or ladies models The Chinese brands have them, of course, since they make accordions for both students and the budget market. Also the lightest best sounding, prettiest accordions of all are the single row diatonic Cajun accordions from SW Louisiana:  They are light because they don;t have a lot of notes, but they also use the best reeds in the world, usually, hand made Italian reeds. 7 lbs or less, usually. Get one with your name engraved, built just for you, $2200 or so, USD.

If being light weight is of the most primary importance in an accordion for you, then you might want to consider a digital accordion. Check Roland's website for the latest models. http://www.rolandus.com/categories/keyboards/v-acccordion/ The current models have some great internal sounds that work well for just about all types of music styles excepting Zydeco. The latest digital accordions are very light and worth considering if you have back issues, or want to play with headphones and not annoy the neighbors.
